dict.acceptation: 令人震惊的，可怕的；触目惊心的；〈口〉非常粗陋的；
使…震惊( shock的现在分词)；

sent.orig: The barman reeled for a moment, hit by a shocking, incomprehensible sense of distance.
sent.trans: 酒吧老板被一个无法想象的距离的震惊感觉冲击得一阵眩晕。

sent.orig: It is also the price of natural shocking, comparable to a luxury sports car.
sent.trans: 它的售价自然也令人瞠目结舌，堪比一辆顶级豪华跑车。

sent.orig: When he has been on the island about twenty-two years, Crusoe makes another shocking discovery.
sent.trans: 当鲁滨逊在岛上度过大约22年的时候，他又有了一个令人震惊的发现。

sent.orig: Shelly: Yeah. That was shocking. There have always been so many rumors about him.
sent.trans: 莎莉：是啊。那次真吓人。一直都有一堆关于他的传言呢。

sent.orig: The report lays bare the shocking housing conditions in this city.
sent.trans: 那份报告揭露了这座城巿恶劣的住房条件。
